name: interviewstarttime
caption::English: Start time of interview

name: interviewdate
caption::English: Date of interview

name: Generalmodule
caption::English: General Module

name: gen_1_1
caption::English:
This instrument was developed by the Population Health Metrics Research Consortium.

Swipe to begin the General Information Module.

name: gen_1_2
caption::English: Instructions to interviewer: Introduce yourself and explain the purpose of your visit. Ask to speak to the mother or to another adult who was the deceased's main caretaker during the illness that led to death. If this is not possible, arrange a time to revisit the household when the caretaker will be home.

name: gen_1_3
caption::English: My name is [your name]. I am your interviewer with (Organization Name). I have been informed that a death has occurred in your household. I am very sorry to hear that a member of your household has passed away. Please accept my sympathies. For the purpose of improving health care, we are collecting information on all recent deaths in this area. I would like to talk to the mother or main caretaker of the deceased and ask some questions about the events and any symptoms that the deceased had during her/his illness before death.

name: sid
caption::English: What is the VA ID number?

name: general2
caption::English: Background Section

name: gen_2_2
caption::English: Interviewer Name?

name: gen_2_2c
caption::English: Interviewer Phone Number?

name: gen_2_2d
caption::English: Interviewer Cell?

name: general3
caption::English: Consent Section

name: gen_3_b
caption::English: INTERVIEWER: Read the consent form to the respondent.  Ask the respondent if he or she has any questions. Once any questions are answered, ask the respondent if he or she is willing to take part in the study.

type: add select one prompt using yesnoonly
name: gen_3_1
caption::English: Did respondent give consent?

name: qconsentCheck
caption::English: No consent

name: gen_3_2
caption::English: Thank the respondent for his/her time and end the interview.

name: gen_5_a
caption::English: Questions on the Deceased Section

name: general5
caption::English: Questions on the Deceased Section

name: gen_5_0
caption::English: What was the name of the deceased?

type: add select one prompt using sex
name: gen_5_2
caption::English: What was the sex of the deceased?

name: birthDate
caption::English: Birth Date

type: add select one prompt using yesnoonly
name: gen_5_1e
caption::English: Is the deceased Birth date known?

name: gen_5_1d
caption::English: What date was the deceased born?
constraint_message::English: Requires a date that is before today
hint::English: Please change the below to match the birth date

name: gen_5_1a
caption::English: Birth Year

name: gen_5_1b
caption::English: Birth Month

name: gen_5_1c
caption::English: Birth Day

name: deathDate
caption::English: Death Date

type: add select one prompt using yesnoonly
name: gen_5_3e
caption::English: Is the date of death known?

name: gen_5_3d
caption::English: What date did the deceased die?
constraint_message::English: Date bust be between the deceased Birth date and today
hint::English: Please change the below to match the date of death

name: gen_5_3a
caption::English: Death Year

name: gen_5_3b
caption::English: Death Month

name: gen_5_3c
caption::English: Death Day

name: lastknownAge
caption::English: Last Known Age

type: add select one prompt using yearMonthDayNoAnswer
name: gen_5_4g
caption::English: What was the last known age of the deceased?
hint::English: Less than 24 hours = 00 days. Enter age in days up to 28 days. Enter 29 days as 1 month. From 1-11 months, enter age in months. Enter 12 months as 1 year. From 1 year, enter age in years.

name: gen_5_4h
caption::English: Years - if one year or older

name: gen_5_4i
caption::English: Months - if less than one year
constraint_message::English: Months must be between 1 and 11.  Enter 12 months as 1 year.

name: gen_5_4j
caption::English: Days - if less than one month
constraint_message::English: Days can not be greater than 28.  Enter as 1 month if over 28 days.

name: gen_5_4a
caption::English: LKA Years

name: gen_5_4b
caption::English: LKA Months

name: gen_5_4c
caption::English: LKA Days

type: add select one prompt using agegroup
name: gen_5_4d
caption::English: What age group does the deceased's last known age fall into?

name: qageCheck
caption::English: No Age

name: gen_5_4e
caption::English: No age has been provided or age group selected.  Please go back and select an age group or thank the respondent for his/her time and end the interview.

name: ageminutes
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: agehours
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: agedays
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: ageweeks
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: agemonths
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: ageyears
relevance: selected(${gen_5_1e}, '1') and selected(${gen_5_3e}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '1') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '2') or selected(${gen_5_4}, '4')

name: adult_7_a
caption::English: Instructions to the interviewer: Say to the respondent: "Thank you for the patient responses to this exhaustive set of questions. Could you please summarize, or tell us in your own words, any additional information about the illness and/or death of your loved one?"

name: adult_7_b
caption::English: To the interviewer: Listen to what the respondent tells you in his/her own words. Do not prompt except for asking whether there was anything else after the respondent finishes. If the respondent mentions any of the following words, mark "mentioned".  Tell the respondent to stop and start again if they mention a word of interest, so you have time to mark it down.
